data.event: Désiré Broussard and Jean-Baptiste Montet settled there by 1823.

event.title: cultivated it for at least 20 years

data.event: Anselm Thibodeaux, who settled on land on the east bank of the river, cultivated it for at least 20 years prior to the Louisiana Purchase in 1803.

event.title: stands at a bridge there today

data.event: The home stands at a bridge there today.

event.title: operated at the Milton site probably as early as 1820

data.event: A ferry operated at the Milton site probably as early as 1820.

event.title: December 14, 1897, meeting of the Vermilion Parish Police Jury, it was suggested

data.event: At the December 14, 1897, meeting of the Vermilion Parish Police Jury, it was suggested that a bridge be built across the river there.
That bridge was dedicated on February 2, 1902.
The present bridge was built in 1948.
